question:
Based on the structured SQL information below, please convert the problem into an SQL query statement. 
 SQL data (already structured as text): | car_1 | continents : contid , continent | countries : countryid , countryname , continent | car_makers : id , maker , fullname ( General Motors ) , country | model_list : modelid , maker , model | car_names : makeid , model , make | cars_data : id , mpg , cylinders , edispl , horsepower , weight , accelerate , year. 
 Question: How many different models has maker with full name General Motors produced? 
 Answer:
answer: select count(distinct t2.model) from car_names as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.model = t2.model join car_makers as t3 on t2.maker = t3.id where t3.fullname = 'General Motors';
label: QA

question:

 Question: Which ones have at least one? || Which ones have no car makers? | What are all the different country names? 
 Answer:
answer: select t1.countryname from countries as t1 join car_makers as t2 on t1.countryid = t2.country group by t1.countryid having count(*) >= 1;

 SQL data (already structured as text): | network_1 | highschooler : id , name , grade | friend : student_id , friend_id | likes : student_id , liked_id. 
 Question: What is the name of the high schooler who has the greatest number of friends? 
 Answer:
answer: select t2.name from friend as t1 join highschooler as t2 on t1.student_id = t2.id group by t1.student_id order by count(*) desc limit 1
